But the P&L does not reflect that, in fact net income has been declining from peak $1.2B in 2010 down to net loss $39M in 2012. I don't know what the non-cash items were. Again, AMZN get external financing for CapEx for expanding the business, not for operating activities. Amazon can improve the bottom line significantly and Mr. Bezos needs to reevaluate his stand of discounting. 2010, 2011, 2012 Year 86%, 89%, 89% % of cost of sales to net product sales 9.4%, 10.9%, 12.4% % of fulfillment to net product sales 95.7%, 99.7%, 101.3% % of Total COGS to net product sales $3.4B, $6.1B, $9.4B Net service revenue To me fulfillment is part of COGS, from above table, Amazon is not making money at all from product sales for 2011 and 2012, even worse, losing money in 2012 (cost was 101.3%). Amazon is practically giving everything away for free, except for services. That is why net income dropped from 2010 to 2012. From P&L perspective, service revenue alone is barely enough to cover operations, MG&A and other expenses. For 2012, 10% margin on product sales would add $5.2B to bottom line, (20% margin, $10.3B to bottom line), (30% margin, $15.5B to bottom line). For Amazon, free or hugh discount is not acceptable. Whatever benefit that service revenue got from that policy was not good enough, not even adequate. Cheers!
